Ren--
Yes, and YES!  :)  The coffee hounds have already secured my promise of auction coffee :)

Dana

--
>


Wow...it's been a very long time!

Are you all going to the Life is Good conference in May by any chance?? If so are you bringing some coffee for the raffle?:)

Ren

messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, The Coffee Goddess <hoffmanwilson@...> wrote:
>
> I have no idea how long it's been since I posted here, but I have been no-mail for a long time...
>
> I'm Dana, radical unschooling mama to Lauren, 16, Otto, 11, and Miranda, 9 months.  We live in beautiful Bellingham, WA.  I am a coffee roasting goddess and a barista extraordinaire, and as I sit on the internet between customers, I needed a little more reading material, so I signed up to get emails again....And I thought I'd introduce myself incase I feel inclined to write ;)
>
> So....hi :)
> Dana
>


Wow...it's been a very long time!

Are you all going to the Life is Good conference in May by any chance?? If so are you bringing some coffee for the raffle?:)

Ren
radicalunschooling.blogspot.com

messages.msgSnippet: ... Robin B. P.S. She is indeed the coffee roasting goddess. Her Day of the Dead   roast is, uh, to die for . Not only that, she s probably the first
messages.messageBody:
>>Hey, Dana! Good to see you here again.

Robin B.

P.S. She is indeed the coffee roasting goddess. Her "Day of the Dead" 
roast is, uh, to die for <g>. Not only that, she's probably the first 
true radical unschooler I met in WA. I've learned a lot from her, and 
her kids.>>

Oh, good to see you here, too, Robin!  :)  Thanks for the coffee compliments! 

Dana

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] re-introduction...
messages.msgSnippet: Hey, Dana! Good to see you here again. Robin B. P.S. She is indeed the coffee roasting goddess. Her Day of the Dead roast is, uh, to die for . Not only
messages.messageBody:
Hey, Dana! Good to see you here again.

Robin B.

P.S. She is indeed the coffee roasting goddess. Her "Day of the Dead"
roast is, uh, to die for <g>. Not only that, she's probably the first
true radical unschooler I met in WA. I've learned a lot from her, and
her kids.

On Mar 19, 2009, at 9:43 AM, The Coffee Goddess wrote:

messages.subject: re-introduction...
messages.msgSnippet: I have no idea how long it s been since I posted here, but I have been no-mail for a long time... I m Dana, radical unschooling mama to Lauren, 16, Otto, 11,
messages.messageBody:
I have no idea how long it's been since I posted here, but I have been no-mail for a long time...

I'm Dana, radical unschooling mama to Lauren, 16, Otto, 11, and Miranda, 9 months.  We live in beautiful Bellingham, WA.  I am a coffee roasting goddess and a barista extraordinaire, and as I sit on the internet between customers, I needed a little more reading material, so I signed up to get emails again....And I thought I'd introduce myself incase I feel inclined to write ;)

So....hi :)
Dana
